content.text:
# Draft:Honduras–United Kingdom relations

Honduras–United Kingdom relations encompass the diplomatic, economic, and historical interactions between the Republic of Honduras and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. Both countries maintain smooth economic relations.
Economic relations
Following Brexit (withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union), the UK and Honduras signed the Central America–United Kingdom Association Agreement on 18 July 2019. The Central America–United Kingdom Association Agreement is a continuity trade agreement, based on the European Union free trade agreement, which entered into force on 1 January 2021. Trade value between Central America and the United Kingdom was worth £2,624 million in 2022. By 2023, total trade between Honduras and the United Kingdom was valued at £162 million.
Diplomatic missions
Honduras has an embassy in London.
United Kingdom is accredited to Honduras from its embassy in Guatemala City.
